item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (424 points | 75 comments)
2. How much memory do you need in 2024 to run 1M concurrent tasks? (24 points | 1 comment)
3. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (268 points | 25 comments)
4. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (144 points | 29 comments)
5. Microbenchmarks Are Experiments (11 points | 1 comment)
6. Show HN: Screen Sharing in the Browser–No Downloads, No Registrations (14 points | discuss)
7. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (208 points | 101 comments)
8. Tk9.0: CGo-free, cross platform GUI toolkit for Go (156 points | 51 comments)
9. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (30 points | 1 comment)
10. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (61 points | 22 comments)
11. In the Rockets' Red Glare: The past and future of hot-rodding in America (42 points | 31 comments)
12. Car tires shed a quarter of all microplastics in the environment (117 points | 117 comments)
13. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (110 points | 44 comments)
14. Canada Competition Bureau sues Google for anti-competitive conduct in online ads (32 points | 6 comments)
15. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (89 points | 10 comments)
16. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (9 points | discuss)
17. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (12 points | 4 comments)
18. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (8 points | discuss)
19. You can use C-Reduce for any language (462 points | 102 comments)
20. QwQ: Alibaba's O1-like reasoning LLM (304 points | 226 comments)
21. Aftershock II (9 points | 2 comments)
22. Hetzner cuts traffic on US VPSs, raises prices (262 points | 503 comments)
23. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (259 points | 208 comments)
24. Spotify has shut down several API endpoints (171 points | 130 comments)
25. Engineers Do Not Get to Make Startup Mistakes When They Build Ledgers (71 points | 70 comments)
26. Malware can turn off webcam LED and record video, demonstrated on ThinkPad X230 (976 points | 501 comments)
27. Show HN: Myphotos.site – Make a gallery website from Google Photos (150 points | 70 comments)
28. A washing machine for human beings, from 1970 (134 points | 172 comments)
29. MIT Aluminum Bicycle Project 1974 (2016) (176 points | 134 comments)
30. Bananas: Cross-Platform screen sharing made simple (188 points | 52 comments)
